comments.body: As this is an array of bytes (not a pointer to "we don't know what") I'd prefer this to be `const char* fBuffer{nullptr}`
This will be removed in separate PR - I already have code, but do not want to push it here, while it also depends from https patch

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@
   struct RawBuffer {
      const void *fBuffer{nullptr}; ///<! raw buffer
      unsigned fLength{0};          ///<! data length
      bool fOwner{false};        ///<! owner of raw buffer

comments.body: Do you need this to be a non-const reference? You could use simply a `std::shared_ptr<RawBuffer> buf` and then `fBuf(std::move(buf))` to avoid extra reference counting operations.
Please don't use leading underscores for function names. Isn't this already a private function?

I use underscore symbol to signal, that function must be used with locked mutex. 
Are there any code convention about this in ROOT?
